name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Beautiful horse barn stable venue for weddings and special events. Lots of options for the wedding ceremony and a great patio with stage, fireplace and string lights for a reception. Lots of photo opportunities! The owner was very friendly and gave us an informative tour.

name: Maegan Ingram
text: I cannot say enough good things about Windwood Equestrian! The venue is absolutely gorgeous and made my wedding truly look like a dream. When you are venue shopping for your wedding, keep Windwood in mind!

name: Natalie Cohen
text: Windwood Equestrian is a beautiful venue to have your wedding! If you are a horse person or love a beautiful place to get married at then this is it! I highly recommend getting married at Windwood. They are super nice and made me feel so comfortable on my wedding day!

name: Lauren Johnson
text: I had a wonderful experience at Windwood for my wedding. The venue is gorgeous and the staff make everything so easy. Arden was great to work with and my wedding flowed so well. I received so many compliments on the venue and horses. I would highly recommend this venue for a wedding or rehearsal dinner!

name: Kelly Smith
text: We got married at Windwood Equestrian a few weeks ago and our experience with Mo from beginning to end was wonderful!  The venue is absolutely beautiful and was just the perfect backdrop for what our guests say was the "perfect wedding!"

name: Brian Johnsen
text: My daughter is being trained by Jill, who's the Best!

name: Sabrena Wheeler
text: Do they have summer riding camps

name: Kelsey Trump
text: Beautiful location! Great place to board a horse, very nice arena and beautiful barn with many amenities!

name: Bethany Claxton
text: We love Seven Oaks and our wonderful trainer, Annie.

name: Sara Whitchurch
text: Great place! If you are looking for Horse boarding or Riding Lessons This is the place to go!

name: Rebecca Walker-Jones
text: Wonderful horseback riding in a fabulous location!

name: todd moore
text: Peaceful and serene, nature the way God intended. Beautiful horses and the kindest humans around.

name: Julie Garrett
text:
We love Rocking S! My daughter attended a camp this Summer and fell in love with horses and riding!She has now been riding there for six months and has learned so much from Suzanne and the wonderful staff. I cannot say enough about what they have taught her about riding as well as life.
It is her happy place and she never wants to leave!

name: Meagan Sharp
text: My daughter is in love with Rocking S. She has had an amazing experience and has learned so much. The people are extremely friendly and allow her to not only ride but form bonding friendships as well.  Suzanne has taught my daughter so so much!  Rocking S is definitely part of our family now!

name: Fallon Brewer
text: We absolutely LOVE Rocking S! Suzanne and all the staff are always friendly and helpful and patient and supportive teaching riders of all ages! My daughter has learned so much and improved in such a short time thanks to their hard work and dedication!

name: Samantha Hill
text: We love Rocking S Farm! Suzanne is truly devoted to providing students and families with the best experience!

name: JC Minton
text: Very friendly and professional. My daughter tried several different places for riding lessons and loves coming here.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Rocking S!

name: Gwynne Mountz
text: My daughter (8) and I just had our first Saddle Seat lesson at Rocking S Farm. We loved it!! My daughter couldn't stop talking about it on the ride home. She was even talking about it the next day! We have both ridden before but never Saddle Seat. I thought it'd be a great idea if we signed up for lessons together. We had so much fun! Suzanne and her team are so friendly and knowledgeable! The horses are great too! You can tell they are well taken care of and are ridden often. We can't wait for our next lesson!

name: Itz_Melon_ •_•
text: Ok... The lessons were great. I had a lot of fun my first time. But they REALLY rushed Pepper (my horse) and me. They started making me post on my second lesson when I had barely learned how to steer! And don't get me started on Suzanne... So judgemental. I couldn't but I go to a way better place now, they really take their time on me.

name: melissa lamarque
text: My daughter attended horse camp here and loved it. She learned all about care for the horses, riding, and arts and crafts. She is already asking to attend again!

resp.text: We loved having her and hope you you are making plans to allow her to attend one of the many camps scheduled for 2020 and maybe even sign up for regular lessons!

name: Levi Miller
text: So horrible service rude and got mad when I asked how much do you feed him and kicked me out never go!

name: Taylor Pope
text: I love this farm is amazing for lessons party’s and camps it’s sooooo good everyone is so nice and welcoming

resp.text: We love having you!  Hope to see you soon!

name: Kassady Gibson
text: We had an amazing time at the Princess Pony Camp and will definitely be back!  This is a great place for riding and birthday parties.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your time with us and hope you make plans to visit with us again!

name: mckina1
text: I would like to apologize for posting any personal opinions that may have led any individual to believe that Rocking S Farms of Helena, AL, or it's owner, Suzanne Schnetzler, would be an unsuitable choice for riding lessons, boarding services or horse training. Ms. Schnetzler is genuinely kind to the students she instructs and tirelessly devotes herself to the upkeep and operation of her farm. It is not for me to say if it is right or wrong for a consumer to choose this service over another. I extend my sincerest apologies.

resp.text: Thank you for your apology and recognition that our staff is “tirelessly devoted”  to our little piece of Heaven on earth.

name: christy graff
text:
My granddaughter takes riding lessons at Rocking S Farm.  She also goes to the camps during the summer.  Believe ME if her family thought for one moment that this place was not up to standards she would not still be there after a year.  She had her 9th birthday party there and she fell in love with the farm and the animals.  I have found that when one writes a bad review on a business it is usually from a disgruntled employee or in competition with the establishment.

My granddaughter has learned how to ride and take care of horses.  She has learned that there is a lot of work that goes into running a stable and loves the hands on experience.

I have referred Rocking S Farm to a lot of people that are looking for an unique experience for their children.  I would not compromise my reputation if I did not approve of Rocking S. Farm.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  We have loved watching our little “baby cakes” grow into a confident young lady over the years!

name: Mallie Hankes
text:
I have worked at rocking s farm for almost three years now and have been apart of them even longer. some reviews on here are quite ridiculous. Suzanne has never been arrested (lol) and is very committed to the upkeep and welfare of her farm. I can attest to this by the many, many days I have been there. the horses are feed twice a day as they should be and are given the correct and necessary treatment. I have even shadowed the large animal vet rocking s uses and she does a fine job. the stalls are always, always cleaned twice a day. I know this because Im usually cleaning them. if suzanne ever lacks help she will muck stalls on her own. she cares for her horses and only gives jobs to the people who clean the stalls correctly, which some how seemed to be quite hard for some. yes the kids help w chores but that's part of the whole horse riding experience. it's great that she includes the kids in this. it teaches them responsibility. by taking care of the animals the kids bond with them and learn the necessities of taking care of horses. farriers come to the barn regularly for saddlebreds and the other horses. it is a wonderful little barn full of wonderful people. the negative reviews on here are honestly absurd and obviously don't know what they're talking about.

also a negative reviewer posted a picture on here. horses who live in pastures are going to get scratched. it's absolutely inevitable. I've owned many horses before who have been pasture boarded and different barns and can say this w full knowledge. it is not evidence that rocking s farm is unsuitable. the horse doesn't need a vet to some out it only needs for the wound to be cleaned and medicated (which it has been).

name: Coach Jimmy
text: kind of rude on the phone...doesn't know how to answer phone.

name: Michael Vandergriff
text: Outstanding riding academy for young people to learn how to care for and ride horses.

name: Michael Graves
text: Great night with kids for Halloween.

name: Fearless Bird
text:
Nice people, great community service,but horrible manipulators and Liars handing out false hope to those on fixed income. When a person says I have bad credit, low income, and NO cosigner be honest and don't tell them to go ahead and drive there bearly functioning vehicle up a mountain to see you when ya know they're just going to get turned down.

Wish I could block them from my life.

name: Charles Dean
text: Great concert and fireworks show.

name: chris ragan
text: It is always a great adventure to go to the North East Alabama Agri- Business in Rainsville Al. They have a great facility and the Staff is as professional as you get. Love the rodeos there.

name: Amiryah Evans
text: Amazing people. Clean as a whistle. Amazing show.

name: Craig Storey
text: Nice Facility.  Nice People

name: Steve Mitchell
text: What an Awesome Facility!! Eric, Brian and the Staff were Great! We Enjoyed Our Visit During the Alabama High School Rodeo. Thank you All.

name: Keith Byrd
text: Good clean arena.

name: Sheril Miller
text: Fun rodeo!

name: Dannielle Steele
text: Clean & welcoming!

name: Anna Nappier
text: Very nice area to host all different types of events.

name: Rickey Moore
text: Perfect for lots of events
